sense.gloss: to throw away, to cast away, to dump, to discard
to abandon, to desert, to leave
cutting a person down (without a second thought), sacrificing, throwing to the wolves, treating as sword fodder
to cut off and throw away
to abandon, to disregard, to discard, to throw to the wolves
to discard (numbers after a certain decimal place), to drop, to omit, to ignore, to round down
addressing (someone) without using a suffix such as "-san" or "-chan" (considered impolite)
to abandon, to fail, to desert, to forsake
putting one's life on the line, giving everything one has got, acting out of desperation
adoption or rejection, selection, choice, option
to get off, to abandon (a ship or vehicle)
to throw off (clothes), to cast off, to fling off, to kick off (shoes)
to cast off (old ideas, habits, etc.), to discard
ornamental garden stone (placed to give a natural appearance), garden rock
stones used in a foundation, riprap
selection, making a choice, sifting, decision to adopt or reject
to abandon, to throw away, to discard, to forsake
sacrifice sale, selling for a song, dumping
to write and throw away, to write carelessly, to begin writing then stop part-way through
to spit out, to eject, to dump
renouncing the flesh or the world, becoming a priest
sacrificing one's life for the sake of mankind or Buddhist teachings
dumping spot, (good) place to dispose of something, (right) time to give something up (e.g. one's life)
practice of abandoning old people, usu. women
mountain where old people were abandoned (according to legend)
position or division in a company to which an old and ineffective person is transferred
inexcusable, unpardonable, can't be allowed to pass (without comment)
to leave as is, to ignore
to leave something as it is
photographic prints that you don't keep

sdata.j: なぁ、↑金↑↓かね↓は↑無↑↓な↓いかもしれないけどまだプライドは↑捨↑↓す↓てちゃいないんだ。
sdata.e: Hey, I may have no money, but I still have my pride.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓なら↑成功↑↓せいこう↓できるよ、がんばって。↑僕↑↓ぼく↓は↑見捨↑↓みす↓てない。
sdata.e: You can make it! Go for it. I'll stand by you.

sdata.j: ↑空腹↑↓くうふく↓で↑苦↑↓くる↓しむ↑地域↑↓ちいき↓があるというのに、↑日本↑↓にっぽん↓↑国内↑↓こくない↓では↑多↑↓おお↓くのレストランや↑家庭↑↓かてい↓でも↑多量↑↓たりょう↓の↑食↑↓た↓べ↑物↑↓もの↓が↑捨↑↓す↓てられているというのは、はずかしい↑事実↑↓じじつ↓です。
sdata.e: It is a shameful fact that, while there are lands where people suffer from hunger, within Japan there are many households and restaurants where much food is thrown away.

sdata.j: ↑銀行↑↓ぎんこう↓と↑言↑↓い↓うのはお↑天気↑↓てんき↓の↑日↑↓ひ↓に↑傘↑↓かさ↓を↑貸↑↓か↓したがるが、↑雨↑↓あめ↓の↑日↑↓ひ↓には、↑人↑↓ひと↓を↑見捨↑↓みす↓てようとするところだ。
sdata.e: Banks will try to lend you an umbrella on a sunny day, but they will turn their backs on a rainy day.

sdata.j: ↑金↑↓かね↓をどぶに↑捨↑↓す↓てるようなものである。
sdata.e: It's money down the drain.

sdata.j: ↑近頃↑↓ちかごろ↓では、↑町↑↓まち↓を↑歩↑↓ある↓くと↑必↑↓かなら↓ず↑人↑↓ひと↓がゴミを↑捨↑↓す↓てるところを↑見↑↓み↓かけます。
sdata.e: These days you can't walk down the street without seeing people dropping litter.

sdata.j: ↑脚↑↓あし↓の↑壊↑↓こわ↓れている↑椅子↑↓いす↓は↑捨↑↓す↓てなさい。
sdata.e: Throw away the chairs whose legs are broken.

sdata.j: ↑希望↑↓きぼう↓を↑捨↑↓す↓ててはいけないよ。
sdata.e: You must not give up hope.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑互↑↓たが↓いに↑相手↑↓あいて↓を↑見捨↑↓みす↓てないと↑約束↑↓やくそく↓した。
sdata.e: We made a pact that we wouldn't abandon one another.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑皆↑↓みな↓↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓がなぜあんな↑感↑↓かん↓じのいい↑男↑↓おとこ↓を↑捨↑↓す↓てたのか↑不思議↑↓ふしぎ↓に↑思↑↓おも↓った。
sdata.e: We all wondered why she had dumped such a nice man.

sdata.j: ↑一↑↓いち↓↑円↑↓えん↓↑以下↑↓いか↓は↑四捨五入↑↓ししゃごにゅう↓してよろしい。
sdata.e: Count as one fractions of half a yen and over, but ignore those of less.

sdata.j: ↑悪癖↑↓あくへき↓を↑捨↑↓す↓てるのは↑簡単↑↓かんたん↓ではない。
sdata.e: It is not easy to get rid of bad habits.

sdata.j: レンタカーの↑乗↑↓の↓り↑捨↑↓すて↓て↑料金↑↓りょうきん↓はいくらだろう？
sdata.e: How much more does it cost to return the rental car to another location?

sdata.j: もし↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑手紙↑↓てがみ↓を↑送↑↓おく↓ってきたら、↑私↑↓わたし↓はみな↑破↑↓やぶ↓り↑捨↑↓す↓ててしまう。
sdata.e: If he sends me any letters, I just tear them up and throw them away.

sdata.j: もう↑少↑↓すこ↓しやさしく↑意見↑↓いけん↓してあげたらどうなの。↑一刀両断↑↓いっとうりょうだん↓のもと↑切↑↓き↓り↑捨↑↓す↓てられた↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑立場↑↓たちば↓も↑考↑↓かんが↓えてよ。
sdata.e: Why don't you try expressing your opinion a little more gently? Think about how he feels getting told flatly that he's being cut loose.

sdata.j: まさしくイギリスと↑事情↑↓じじょう↓は↑同↑↓おな↓じで、↑家↑↓いえ↓を↑買↑↓か↓うことは↑可能↑↓かのう↓であった。ただし、↑自分↑↓じぶん↓が↑気↑↓き↓に↑入↑↓い↓った↑家↑↓いえ↓を↑手頃↑↓てごろ↓な↑値段↑↓ねだん↓で↑買↑↓か↓うという↑考↑↓かんが↓えを↑捨↑↓す↓てれば、という↑条件↑↓じょうけん↓が↑付↑↓つ↓くのであった。
sdata.e: It was quite possible to buy a house, just as it is in England, provided one gives up the idea of buying a home one likes, and at a reasonable price.

sdata.j: パットは↑服↑↓ふく↓を↑脱↑↓ぬ↓ぎ↑捨↑↓す↓てて、↑水↑↓みず↓の↑中↑↓なか↓に↑飛↑↓と↓び↑込↑↓こ↓んだ。
sdata.e: Pat stripped off his clothes and dived in.

sdata.j: ねずみはいち↑早↑↓はや↓く↑沈↑↓しず↓みそうな↑船↑↓ふね↓を↑見捨↑↓みす↓てる。
sdata.e: Rats leave a sinking ship.

sdata.j: なんということ、↑未来↑↓みらい↓は↑捨↑↓す↓てられてしまった。
sdata.e: For God's sake, tomorrow's left behind.

sdata.j: ドライバーの↑多↑↓おお↓くが↑雪↑↓ゆき↓の↑中↑↓なか↓に↑車↑↓くるま↓を↑乗↑↓の↓り↑捨↑↓す↓てた。
sdata.e: Many drivers abandoned their cars in the snow.

sdata.j: トムに↑金↑↓きん↓を↑貸↑↓か↓すのは↑海↑↓うみ↓に↑金↑↓きん↓を↑投↑↓な↓げ↑捨↑↓す↓てるようなものだ。
sdata.e: I might as well throw my money into the sea as lend it to Tom.

sdata.j: たけしは↑僕↑↓ぼく↓の↑宿題↑↓しゅくだい↓を↑手伝↑↓てつだ↓うと↑約束↑↓やくそく↓したのに、↑最後↑↓さいご↓になって↑僕↑↓ぼく↓を↑見捨↑↓みす↓てた。
sdata.e: Takeshi promised to help me with my homework, but at the last minute he let me down.

sdata.j: そんな↑考↑↓かんが↓えは↑捨↑↓す↓てなさい。
sdata.e: Give up such ideas.

sdata.j: そんな↑計画↑↓けいかく↓は↑捨↑↓す↓ててしまいなさい。
sdata.e: Put the plan on the scrap heap.

sdata.j: そんな↑甘↑↓あま↓い↑考↑↓かんが↓えは↑捨↑↓す↓てなさい。
sdata.e: Get rid of those kinds of naive ideas.

sdata.j: そんなばかげた↑考↑↓かんが↓えは↑捨↑↓す↓てなさい。
sdata.e: Put away such a foolish idea.

sdata.j: それは↑聞↑↓き↓き↑捨↑↓ず↓てならんな。
sdata.e: I cannot let it go unchallenged.

sdata.j: それはくずだ。↑捨↑↓す↓てなさい。
sdata.e: It's junk. Throw it away.

sdata.j: その↑少女↑↓しょうじょ↓は↑歌手↑↓かしゅ↓になる↑考↑↓かんが↓えを↑捨↑↓す↓てなければならなかった。
sdata.e: The girl had to abandon the idea of becoming a singer.

sdata.j: その↑事↑↓こと↓についての↑疑↑↓うたが↓いを↑捨↑↓す↓てなくてはならなかった。
sdata.e: I had to get rid of my doubt about it.
